explanation: username on cluster
absolute path to directory that holds all output (and initially input) data for each experiment
absolute path to directory in home directory that contains all maximum likelihood estimation code
absolute path to directory in which temporary output files are placed before being compiled into results
email of user who will receive job notifications from slurm (not relevant on macosx mode)
kind of job scheduler the HPC cluster uses/kind of operating system computer uses (currently only 'slurm' and 'macosx' supported)
maximum number of characters in a list of job arrays to be submitted on cluster (not relevant on macosx mode)
parallel processors to use; do NOT set to >1 for processing on MacOSX
memory (in Mb) needed to run a single MLE (not relevant on macosx mode)
time (in mins) alotted for running single MLE (not relevant on macosx mode)
max memory (in Mb) a job is allowed to request (not relevant on macosx mode)
max time (in minutes) a job is allowed to request (not relevant on macosx mode)
maximum number of jobs that can be submitted in a single batch job (if set to very high number will default to the maximum number the system allows)
list of variable names for input files that MLE program will look for
list of files corresponding to each variable name listed in datafile_keys

list of 'modes' in which MLE fitting happens separated by vertical bars ('|'); matlab code for performing MLE for a given mode should be called 'MLE_<mode_name>.m' and matlab code for simulating data for a given mode should be called 'sim_<mode_name>.m'
list of parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list

list of mstarting values for each of the parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list and parameters in same order as in parameters by mode

list of lower bound values for each of the parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list and parameters in same order as in parameters by mode

list of upper bound values for each of the parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list and parameters in same order as in parameters by mode
number of positions per dimension at which to start multistart (if 0 run fglobalsearch) separated by vertical bars ('|') for each mode
list of parameters across which multistart selects grid points
parameters whose profiles (and MLE runs!) should be done in log rather than in linear space

values that scale the approximate CI of each parameter to a consistent value (e.g. 1); for parameters estimated in logspace the scaling occurs after converting the parameter to logspace; so the distance between the natural log of the CI bounds should be scaled to the consistent value
tolerance on ML-identified values in scaled and if needed log-transformed parameter space
tolerance on ML-identified LL or gradient
number of points to estimate fixed parameter MLE at for LL profile

list of min values used in the LL for each of the parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list and parameters in same order as in parameters by mode

list of max values used in the LL for each of the parameters in each mode of 'mode list'; parameters separated by semicolons and modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list and parameters in same order as in parameters by mode
p-val of CIs identified in each mode; modes are separated by vertical bars; modes appear in same order as in mode list
percentile of runtimes to report from within each parameter's profile point run
list of parameters within each mode which will get a simulation-based CI
number times data is simulated to calculate likelihood ratio distributions for hypothesis testing in each mode
memory (in Mb) needed to run a single simulation (not relevant on macosx mode)
time (in mins) alotted for running single simulation (not relevant on macosx mode)
(For mutation effect estimation only) Size of x-axis (ln(mut effect)) used for initial MLE; centered on 0
(For mutation effect estimation only) log2(number of gridpoints for pdf determination) used for initial MLE
(For mutation effect estimation only) gridpoints in empirical pdf (for mut
(For mutation effect estimation only) empirically determined mean number of SNMs per strain
